sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Good morning Europe. It's Thursday the 3rd of March. Thank you for joining us here on the program.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We'll be bringing you continuous coverage of Russia's war on Ukraine throughout the day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Here are the latest developments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russian forces intensify their shelling of Ukrainian urban areas

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: and claim to have control of the strategic port city of Kherson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich puts chelsea football club up for sale as calls grow in the uk for him to face sanctions more anti-war protests take place in saint petersburg we hear from russian citizens about how they feel about the conflict how they feel about the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Residents in Kherson wake up under Russian control after the strategically important Black Sea port appears to have become the first major city to fall to the invasion force.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Russian military has intensified its shelling of Ukrainian cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The mayor of Mariupol in the south described the attacks as relentless.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Massive explosions were heard in Kiev early Thursday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Locals had once again taken cover in shelters or basements during the now-regular night curfew.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: More than 2,000 Ukrainian civilians have been killed since the Russian invasion, according to Ukraine's emergency service.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In a statement, it said hundreds of structures, including transport facilities, hospitals, kindergartens and homes, have been destroyed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, ahead of a visit to the Baltic states and Moldova, stopped short of saying the Kremlin was deliberately targeting civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We've certainly seen in the past that one of Russia's methods of war is to be absolutely brutal in trying to cow the citizenry of a given country. And that includes, at the very least, indiscriminate targeting." Russia's invasion of Ukraine has prompted unprecedented, wide-ranging economic and even sporting sanctions, appearing to have caught out President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He's embarked on a series of meetings with Russia's business leaders to discuss tackling their consequences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, in the western Ukrainian city of Lviv, a Greek Orthodox Church is collecting donations for those currently fighting on the front line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While the devout pray for peace, talks between Ukraine and Russia are expected to resume as negotiators travel to Belarus for another meeting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron has spoken to the nation on his response to the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Macron strongly condemned Russian President Vladimir Putin for starting the conflict and called for a ceasefire to allow humanitarian aid to be delivered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He warned the war would have a negative impact on the French economy, but said he would bring in new measures including more investment in nuclear energy to absorb the downturn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Macron praised the Ukrainian people for their bravery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We are behind and there to support Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We are there to support Ukrainian citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In your name, I'd like to address the President Volodymyr Lenskid, the support of France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Today is at the head of his highly courageous people here, the face of bravery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Faced with the threat of financial sanctions, Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich is selling his Premier League football club Chelsea. In a statement he said it was an incredibly difficult decision which pains him. The Russian will not ask for any loans he made to the club worth 1.8 billion euros to be repaid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And said proceeds of the sale will be donated to victims of the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Abramovich's announcement comes after increasing calls from the UK government to impose sanctions on him along with other Russian oligarchs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The 55-year-old has come under increasing pressure to part company with the club due to his alleged association with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It is something he denies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Abramovich bought Chelsea in 2003 for nearly 170 million euros and says it had never been about business or money but about pure passion for the game and club.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: No one from Chelsea has commented on the prospective sale.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Apple is pulling sales from Russia in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's a rare political stand for the American tech giant, which has been criticized in the past for being too accommodating of foreign governments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Apple doesn't operate any physical stores in Russia, and Russian sales are believed to represent only 2% of its total revenues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But it still stands to lose billions of dollars in sales, and competitors could step in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The interesting thing now is going to be whether we see the Chinese manufacturers filling the void left by Apple and other consumer electronics brands. We don't know how that's going to work yet and what China's attitude to sanctions will be, but I would highly suspect that we will see some of the Chinese brands ramping up their volumes in the Russian market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Other multinational companies have also distanced themselves from Russia since the invasion, including the three biggest shipping companies in the world. Danish shipping group Maersk said it would temporarily halt all container shipping to and from Russia. The company said the suspension would not apply to food, medical or humanitarian supplies. French oil giant Total has been under pressure to join companies like BP, Shell and ExxonMobil in pulling its investments out of Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And in the automotive sector, Ford, BMW, Jaguar and Volvo have announced they'll halt deliveries or suspend production in the country. Volkswagen is warning that production in Germany could also face disruption as the automaker struggles to get parts from suppliers in war-torn Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A war on the ground in Ukraine, an online war of propaganda and misinformation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In times of conflict, when people are hungry for information, that is when false claims and rumours can spread very easily. Here in the Cube, we have seen misleading claims from both sides and a lot of false videos and misleading content spreading on social media. Let me show you two examples. This is a video that was shared at the very start of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. People claiming that this showed an explosion taking place in one of this country's largest cities. However this video is misleading. You can reverse search for images from this video and find when it actually first appeared on the internet. And as you can see, it does not actually show Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It actually shows an explosion that took place in Tianjin in China in the year 2015.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So this video is misleading.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It does not show an explosion in Ukraine amid Russia's invasion in 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But there are also other examples.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is an image that's been going viral on many social media platforms. It shows the mayor of Kiev, Vitaly Klitschko, dressed in combat uniform, saying that he's defending his nation. Now this image is true, but it has also been taken out of context. It is not a new image that shows the mayor of Kiev on the front line. If you go on to his own Instagram page, you can see that this image was actually taken in March 2021, several months before Russia had launched its invasion on Ukrainian territory. So there are two examples of misinformation that are spreading online amid the Ukrainian crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Here in the Cube, we're working to fact-check, debunk and verify all the claims that are being made and all the misinformation that we see online.
